newsitem.title: TURKEY: Five injured in Turkish prison riot.
newsitem.headline: Five injured in Turkish prison riot.

text.p: Turkish prison inmates clashed with guards on Monday in fighting at a jail in western Turkey which left at least five injured, human rights officials said.
Four guards and one para-military gendarme were taken to hospital from Buca jail in the city of Izmir, officials said.
"We have learned that many prisoners were injured in the fighting between them and the guards and gendarmes," said Yuksel Alp from the Turkish Human Rights Association.
Lawyers for the prisoners said one guard had also been taken hostage.
Firefighters had to extinguish a fire that apparently broke out in a section of the prison holding members of the left-wing guerilla group Dev Sol, eye-witnesses said.
But Turkish television channel NTV reported that the fighting had died down and negotiations between the prisoners and authorities were in progress.
The state-run Anatolian news agency said left-wing militants were involved in the riot.
Alp said relations between the prison guards and inmates had worsened since guards carried out a search for a suspected escape tunnel in February.
"From that date there has been continuous tension," he said. Buca houses many leftist and Kurdish rebel prisoners.
